Anybody want to help bikeshed this little Tables.jl utility name? <https://github.com/JuliaData/Tables.jl/pull/233>

I think <@U681ELA87>’s `rowmerge` suggestion is perfect for the underlying non-kwarg function here but seems unintuitive with the kwarg method: `rowmerge(row; x=1, y=2, z=3)`

maybe we should use `rowmerge` for the underlying non-kwarg function here, and then define a more appropriately named function for the kwarg version?

maybe `rowfrom`? `rowfrom(row; x=1, y=2)`
or `copyrow`? `copyrow(row; x=1, y=2)`

thoughts?
